news_items.content: Here's the rewritten version of the news article:
Chennai, India - A 29-year-old woman in Chennai died after being attacked by drunk intruders at home. One person was arrested and another is on the run.
Chennai weather update: Warm and partly cloudy conditions are expected to prevail across the city.
In other news, Air India has inspected 31 operational aircraft after a recent crash. The incident occurred during flight 1231, which took off from Mumbai but crashed into the Arabian Sea.
Chennai News Today brings you the latest updates on various topics, including sports, entertainment, and politics.
Tamil Nadu Fishermen Return From Iran: Three fishermen have been rescued after being stranded in Iranian waters for over a week. Their families are now seeking compensation for their ordeal.
The Indian government is also addressing concerns about women's safety, following the case of Nimisha Priya, whose death sentence has been cancelled in Yemen due to concerns about her mental health.
In sports news, RJ Mahvash says "stealing someone's husband" is a form of cheating. His reaction comes amidst the Yuzvendra Chahal engagement buzz.

Sam Altman, CEO of Nvidia and AMD, has expressed concern that AI could cause job losses and national security threats. He also announced plans to develop a brain made up of dollar symbols for use in Google's search engine.

The latest news on artificial intelligence includes a new AI chatbot developed by Microsoft, Apple, and Google. The technology is designed to improve customer service and provide more accurate information.

Robots are competing with each other in an AI conference in China, where they are being trained to tackle various terrain types. Samsung shares have also jumped due to news of $16.5 billion worth of Tesla chips.

The European Union has unveiled new rules for powerful A.I. systems, which could have significant implications for the tech industry. However, some experts express concerns that these regulations may drive AI development underground.
AI data analyst startup Julius has raised $10 million in a seed round to develop its technology. Harmonic, the CEO of Robinhood's AI math startup, is also launching an AI chatbot app.

The Silicon Valley Chamber of Commerce has expressed concern about the increasing cost of AI subscriptions, which some users are finding difficult to justify. The group argues that AI tools can be used for a range of purposes beyond customer service.
Recent headways in technology include the creation of ultra-thin chips by Harvard researchers and the launch of new artificial intelligence search features on Google's UK website.

Stock Market Highlights: Sensex is currently 572 points lower than its previous day's closing price, while Nifty is below 24,700. Several major companies have experienced significant drops in their share prices.

The Indian government has announced plans to issue visas to Chinese tourists, which could be seen as a way to boost the economy. The UK has also begun work on trade deals with China and other countries.
In sports news, the FIFA World Cup is currently underway in Qatar, where teams from around the world are competing for the coveted title.
